doc.after: The term Cockney has had several distinct geographical social and linguistic associations Originally a pejorative applied to all city dwellers it was eventually restricted to Londoners and particularly to the Bow bell Cockneys 1 those born within earshot of Bow Bells the bells of St Mary le Bow in the eastern Cheapside district of the City of London More recently it is variously used to refer to those in London s East End or to all working class Londoners generally
